content: psl mitts just like their namesake these mitts are the epitome of basic and autumnal they are an excellent first step into the world of fingerless mitts for an advanced or adventurous beginner abbrevs k knit p purl st stitch dpn double-pointed needle k1tbl knit one through the back loop pm place marker sm slip marker m1l left-leaning increase m1r right-leaning increase note if you can t figure out the leaning increases just use whatever increase method you re comfortable with in their place mitts one size women s medium use fingering weight yarn and us 2 needles or size needed to get 28 st / 4 gauge loosely cast on 48 st using larger dpn if necessary and distribute onto three us 2 dpns cuff work in twisted rib k1tbl p1 for 24 rounds or about 2 or however long you want the cuff to be if you prefer not to go tbl regular k1p1 ribbing is fine too lower hand/creating thumb gusset r1-2 knit all stitches r3 k16 pm m1l pm k to end of round r4 k to marker sm m1r k to next marker m1l sm k to end of row r5-6 repeat r1-2 repeat rounds 4-6 plain knitting with an increase row every third row until there are 17 sts between the markers then knit across all stitches removing the markers and placing the 17 sts between them onto scrap yarn they will become the thumb later upper hand k 16 row lengthen or shorten here depending on how much finger coverage you want i like to go to the first knuckle on my ring finger but you do you work 10 row in twisted rib bind off loosely use an elastic bind off or a larger needle or both thumb distribute 17 st from scrap yarn onto three dpn r1 pick up and knit 3 sts at base of thumb then knit across 17 sts 20 sts total r2-6 k around r7-10 twisted rib around bind off in pattern finishing use yarn end closest to thumb base to close up any holes that may have formed weave in all ends make another to complete the pair
